meanings.definition: A device that mixes or stirs fluids.
meanings.sent1: The fluidizer in the lab whirred softly as it mixed the colorful liquids.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used the fluidizer to blend the ingredients for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student accidentally spilled glitter into the fluidizer, creating a sparkly mess.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a fluidizer, stirring up emotions in the room.
meanings.sent5: The fluidizer hummed a soothing tune as it worked its magic on the solutions.

meanings.definition: A substance that makes a material more fluid.
meanings.sent1: The special fluidizer added to the paint helped it flow smoothly on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a drop of the secret fluidizer to the sauce to make it more runny.
meanings.sent3: The magical potion contained a powerful fluidizer that could turn anything into a liquid.
meanings.sent4: His charm acted like a fluidizer, making her heart melt with every word.
meanings.sent5: The fluidizer transformed the thick paste into a silky, flowing substance.

meanings.definition: To make a substance more fluid.
meanings.sent1: She carefully fluidized the clay by adding water to make it easier to mold.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic fluidized the oil to ensure it would smoothly lubricate the engine.
meanings.sent3: The magician fluidized the metal, turning it into a liquid with a wave of his wand.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to fluidize the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The artist fluidized the colors on the palette, creating a beautiful, flowing painting.
